alert.note: Alert for Ascension; Iberville; Livingston (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued January 24 at 8:48PM CST until January 24 at 9:45PM CST by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 PM CST FOR NORTHWESTERN ASCENSION...WEST CENTRAL LIVINGSTON...EASTERN IBERVILLE AND SOUTH CENTRAL EAST BATON ROUGE PARISHES... At 847 PM CST, a squall line capable of producing both tornadoes and straight line wind damage was located near Village St. George, or near Oak Hills Place, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Tornado. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. These dangerous storms will be near... Village St. George around 850 PM CST. Old Jefferson and Shenandoah around 855 PM CST. Port Vincent around 900 PM CST. Walker around 910 PM CST. Livingston around 915 PM CST. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 10 in Louisiana between mile markers 165 and 171. Interstate 12 between mile markers 14 and 24. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris. This cluster of thunderstorms is capable of producing tornadoes and significant wind damage. Do not wait to see or hear the tornado. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
